arm_group.description: Participants were supplemented for 12-weeks with 300 mg of daily oral magnesium oxide.
The control group was educated by a trained dietician to follow a healthy diet.

brief_summary.textblock:
Magnesium deficiency is associated also in the elderly with low physical performance;
      nevertheless trials about the effect of supplementation of magnesium on physical performance
      are not available in old people. The aim of our study is to investigate whether 12-weeks of
      oral magnesium supplementation improves physical performance in healthy elderly women

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Physical Performance After Oral Supplementation of Magnesium in a Sample of Old Women in Good Health

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  People over 65 years, not residents in nursing home, in good health

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous supplementation of calcium, potassium or magnesium

          -  use of pump proton inhibitors or digitalis

          -  important co-mordidities such renal failure

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in short physical performance battery (SPPB)

reference.citation: Dominguez LJ, Barbagallo M, Lauretani F, Bandinelli S, Bos A, Corsi AM, Simonsick EM, Ferrucci L. Magnesium and muscle performance in older persons: the InCHIANTI study. Am J Clin Nutr. 2006 Aug;84(2):419-26.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
